Viral Bule Punguti Sampah, Angin Segar di Tengah Turis Nakal
06 Nov 2019, 12:50 by Ahmad Masaul Khoiri


Bule memungut sampah di pantai Sumba(Foto: Servulus Bobo Riti/Istimewa)

Jakarta - Baru-baru ini viral bule memunguti sampah di salah satu pantai Pulau Sumba. Ini bagaikan jadi angin segar mengingat sebelumnya ramai soal turis nakal ketika berwisata di Indonesia.Bule pemungut sampah ini terlihat melakukan aktivitasnya di Pantai Mananga Aba, Sumba Barat Daya. Turis perempuan itu pun mengajak orang yang tertarik dengan kegiatannya itu untuk ikut serta. Kegiatan bule tersebut menarik pembaca detikcom, Servulus, yang serta-merta mengabadikannya."Pada Minggu sore tersebut, saya dan rekan kerja posisi ke pantai pasir dan saat itu si turis perempuan asik mungut sampah. Saya refleks ambil fotonya dengan meminta izin. Turis tersebut berkata 'it would be better if you can do it, too' saya katakan 'sure, thank you'," urai dia.Apa yang dilakukan bule itu dalam memunguti sampah di tempat wisata jelas patut ditiru oleh siapa saja. Ini sekaligus menegaskan perangai turis asing tak bisa disamaratakan begitu saja ketika berwisata di Indonesia.Bukan apa-apa, dalam catatan detikcom belakangan ini yang ramai adalah keberadaan turis nakal dalam liburannya ke Indonesia. Maka, yang viral saat itu adalah tingkah-polah negatif dari mereka.Sebut saja turis asal Australia yang sempat bikin heboh di Bali karena tendangan kungfunya. Dia mengamuk, menabrakkan diri ke mobil yang melintas, dan menyerang orang-orang. Dia ditangkap oleh warga setempat dengan kondisi tubuh yang terluka, sampai-sampai harus diikat dengan selang.Diketahui, turis tersebut bernama Nicolas Carr berusia 26 tahun asal Australia. Media-media internasional pun memberitakannya.Selanjutnya Halaman1 2

Viral Bule Picks Up Trash, Fresh Wind in the Middle of Naughty Tourists
Nov 6, 2019, 12:50 by Ahmad Masaul Khoiri


Caucasians pick up trash on the Sumba beach (Photo: Servulus Bobo Riti / Special)

Jakarta - Recently Caucasians picked up rubbish on one of the beaches of Sumba Island. This is like a breath of fresh air, remembering that previously it was busy with naughty tourists when traveling in Indonesia. This garbage collector was seen carrying out his activities on Mananga Aba Beach, Southwest Sumba. The woman tourist also invited people who were interested in the activity to participate. The Caucasians' activities attracted detikcom readers, Servulus, who immediately enshrined them. "That Sunday afternoon, my colleague and I were in a position to go to the sand beach and at that time the tourist was cool and trashy. I reflexively took a picture asking for permission. The tourist said 'it would be better if you can do it, too' I say 'sure, thank you', "he explained. What the Caucasians did in picking up trash at tourist sites is definitely worth emulating by anyone. This also confirms the temperament of foreign tourists can not be generalized when traveling in Indonesia. Not anything, in the recent detikcom notes that is busy is the presence of naughty tourists on their holidays to Indonesia. So, what was viral at that time was negative behavior from them. Call it an Australian tourist who had made a scene in Bali because of his martial arts kicks. He went berserk, crashed into a passing car, and attacked people. He was arrested by local residents with the condition of the injured body, to the point of having to be tied with a hose. It is known, the tourist named 26-year-old Nicolas Carr from Australia.
